title: Hidden forces: Soil biodiversity for agricultural production and environmental integrity

tasks.task: Attend and give a presentation on soil biodiversity and its importance in agriculture.
subtasks: Introduce the topic and discuss the hidden forces within soil, emphasizing the diversity of organisms and their roles in ecosystem functions.
Explain the impact of land use intensification on soil biodiversity, including reduced diversity and abundance, and potential local extinctions.

Present studies showing the positive correlation between soil microbial biomass, nematode numbers, and crop yield, highlighting the role of soil organisms in nutrient use efficiency and supporting sustainable agriculture.

Discuss the results of field trials in California and a long-term field experiment in Davis, demonstrating the importance of soil organisms for agricultural productivity and environmental sustainability.
Describe the underpants project (Beweisstck Unterhose) as a citizen science initiative to raise awareness about soil life and collect scientific data on soil health across Switzerland.
Outline the project methodology, including the use of standardized underpants, tea bags, and soil lab kits, and how it involves participants tracking and submitting data via an app.

Highlight the interdisciplinary approach in research, from model systems to field experiments, emphasizing the importance of supporting soil life for sustainable agriculture and environmental integrity.

Address questions about soil sterilization methods, the link between tomato yield and mycorrhizal fungi, differences in soil management effects, and the variability in soil health across various agricultural practices.
Encourage audience members to prioritize soil health and integrate sustainable farming practices that support soil biodiversity for future generations.
